org.smpp

Class Transmitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smpp.SmppObject
      • org.smpp.Transmitter

  • public class Transmitter
extends SmppObject
    Class Transmitter transmits PDUs over connection. It is used by Session.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $
    Author:
    Logica Mobile Networks SMPP Open Source Team
    See Also:
    Connection, Receiver, Session

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.smpp.SmppObject

        DCOM, DCOMD, debug, DPDU, DPDUD, DRXTX, DRXTXD, DRXTXD2, DSESS, DUTL, DUTLD, event

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Transmitter()
      Default constructor made protected as it's not desirable to allow creation of Transmitter without providing Connection.
        Transmitter(Connection c)
      Creates Transmitter which uses provided Connection.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void send(PDU pdu)
      Assigns unique sequence number to PDU, if necessary, and sends its data over connection.

      • Methods inherited from class org.smpp.SmppObject

        getDebug, getEvent, setDebug, setEvent

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Transmitter

        protected Transmitter()
        Default constructor made protected as it's not desirable to allow creation of Transmitter without providing Connection.

      • Transmitter

        public Transmitter(Connection c)
        Creates Transmitter which uses provided Connection. Typically the connection parameter will be an instance of TCPIPConnection class.
        Parameters:
        c - connection used for transmitting the PDUs

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public void send(PDU pdu)
          throws ValueNotSetException,
                 IOException
        Assigns unique sequence number to PDU, if necessary, and sends its data over connection.
        Parameters:
        pdu - the PDU to send
        Throws:
        IOException - exception during communication
        ValueNotSetException - optional param not set but requested
